access_statement_ability_net_2: has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.
access_statement_body_1: This accessibility statement applies to the
access_statement_body_link: 'get a rod fishing licence' service (opens in new tab)
access_statement_body_3: This service is run by the Environment Agency. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this website. For example, that means you should be able to:
access_statement_bulletpoint_1: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
access_statement_bulletpoint_2: zoom in up to 200% without the text spilling off the screen
access_statement_bulletpoint_3: navigate most of the website using just a keyboard
access_statement_bulletpoint_4: navigate most of the website using speech recognition software
access_statement_bulletpoint_5: listen to most of the website using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)
access_statement_compliance_body_1: This website is compliant with the
access_statement_compliance_body_2: This website is partially compliant with the
access_statement_compliance_body_link_1: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.1 AA standard (opens in new tab)
access_statement_compliance_body_link_2: Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.1 AAA standard (opens in new tab)
access_statement_enforcement_body: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the 'accessibility regulations'). If you're not happy with how we respond to your complaint, contact the
access_statement_enforcement_link: Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS) (opens in new tab)
access_statement_heading: Accessibility statement for 'get a rod fishing licence'
access_statement_how_info: All users with access needs can complete the process of buying a fishing rod licence using this service.
access_statement_how_info_2: However, we know that one part of this website is not fully accessible. A calendar date picker control cannot be accessed using a keyboard or screen reader. Users with accessibility requirements can enter the date using the standard day, month and year fields.
access_statement_made_simple: We have also made the website text as simple as possible to understand.
access_statement_nonaccess_body: The content listed below is non-accessible for the following reasons.
access_statement_noncompliance_body_1: We give users the option of a calendar date picker to select a date, but it is not accessible to those using keyboards or screen readers. This fails WCAG 2.1 success criterion
access_statement_noncompliance_body_2: . Users with accessibility requirements can enter this date using the standard day, month and year fields instead. We plan to review this by December 2024.
access_statement_noncompliance_body_3: Colours used for links have insufficient contrast. This fails WCAG 2.1 success criterion
access_statement_noncompliance_body_4: . We plan to review this by December 2024.
access_statement_noncompliance_body_5: Some links are not descriptive of their purpose / destination when browsing out of context. This fails WCAG 2.1 success criterion
access_statement_noncompliance_body_6: . We plan to review this by December 2024.
access_statement_noncompliance_body_link: '2.1.3 Level AAA Keyboard (No Exception)' (opens in new tab)
'2.4.9 Level AAA Link Purpose (Link Only)' (opens in new tab)
access_statement_not_in_scope_title: Content that's not within the scope of the accessibility regulations
access_statement_other_ways_to_buy_subhe: Other ways to buy a licence
access_statement_other_ways_to_buy_body_: You can buy a licence by calling the Environment Agency:
Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm (except public holidays)
Find out about call charges (open in new tab)
access_statement_prep_body_1: This statement was prepared on 23 September 2020. It was last reviewed on 24 April 2024.
access_statement_prep_body_2: This Service was last tested for accessibility on the 24 July 2023. The test was carried out by Digital Accessibility Centre (DAC).
access_statement_prep_body_3: The most common steps tested for purchasing a licence were:
access_statement_prep_body_4: The non-compliant Level AAA elements will be included in ongoing testing and fixing.
access_statement_prep_bulletpoint_1: 12-month: coarse and trout: for my self
access_statement_prep_bulletpoint_2: 12-month: coarse and trout: on someone's behalf
access_statement_reporting_info: We are always looking to improve the accessibility of this website. If you find any problems or issues using our site not listed on this page or think we're not meeting accessibility requirements, let us know via:
access_statement_reporting_subheading: Reporting accessibility problems with this website
access_statement_reporting_body_5: Find out about call charges (open in new tab)
access_statement_tech_body: The Environment Agency is committed to making its website accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.
access_statement_tech_heading: Technical information about this website's accessibility
access_statement_visit_info_link: Environment Agency's office access and opening times (opens in new tab)
access_statement_visit_info_text_service: We do not currently have a text relay service for people who are deaf, hearing impaired or have a speech impediment.
access_statement_visit: If you visit our offices and need assistance or a British Sign Language (BSL) interpreter, you should contact us before your visit. Some of our offices have audio induction loops.

cookies_body_small_files: When you use the Get a Fishing Licence service, we put small files known as cookies onto your computer.
cookies_body_used_for_bulletpoint_1: remember what notifications you’ve seen so that you’re not shown them more than once
cookies_body_used_for_bulletpoint_2: to protect the service against malicious activity
cookies_body_used_for_bulletpoint_3: to ensure that you have a consistent experience when we make changes to the service
cookies_infrastructure_body: These cookies ensure you have a consistent experience when we make changes to the service.
cookies_infrastructure_row_1: Used to ensure you receive a consistent experience
cookies_infrastructure_row_2: 7 days after you stop using the service
cookies_intro_body: You may see a pop-up welcome message when you first visit the service. We’ll store a cookie so that your computer knows you’ve seen it and knows not to show it again.
cookies_intro_row_2: Stores a message to let us know that you have seen our cookie message
cookies_security_body: We store session cookies on your computer to help keep your information secure while you use the service.
cookies_security_table_row_2: 24 hours after you stop using the service
cookies_security_table_row_3: Used to protect the service against malicious activity
cookies_survey_body_2: to collect responses to the survey. If you take part, SmartSurvey will save extra cookies to your computer to track your progress through it.

licence_type_troute_two_rod: The 2 rods coarse licence is the simplest fishing licence. This will cover all the forms of fishing with a rod and let the licence holder fish non-migratory trout and coarse fish. It will allow the licence holder to fish with 1 or 2 rods at the same time, subject to the

new_prices_title: Changes to rod fishing licence costs - GOV.UK
new_prices_heading: Changes to rod fishing licence costs
new_prices_explanation: The cost of a rod fishing licence is increasing to provide vital funds to improve fisheries in England and Wales. The amount you will pay is based on the licence start date (not the date the licence is bought).
new_prices_2_rod_table_heading: Trout and coarse fish licence (up to 2 rods)
new_prices_3_rod_table_heading: Trout and coarse fish licence (up to 3 rods)

newsletter_subscribe: Stay up to date with the latest news on angling, fisheries and how we spend your licence money. You can unsubscribe at any time.
newsletter_title: Would you like to receive our email newsletter?
notification_heading: Plastic-coated card licences will be replaced by a printed letter from 31 May 2024.
notification_text: Choosing to get a licence by email or text message helps reduce the paper we use and invests more licence income back into fishing.

order_complete_when_fishing_bobo_non_pos: An enforcement officer may ask the licence holder if they are covered by a valid fishing licence. They can show them their licence email or text message on their phone. If they show a screenshot of their licence details, the enforcement officer will also ask for proof of their identity.
order_complete_when_fishing_bobo_postal_: An enforcement officer may ask the licence holder if they are covered by a valid fishing licence. They can show them the licence they got in the post, or show their licence email or text message on their phone.

of yearly salmon and sea trout fishing activity in England and Wales. A catch return must be submitted even if no fish are caught or no fishing activity took place.

ordnance_body_1: Addressing information and mapping data from Ordnance Survey is © Crown copyright and database rights 2022
ordnance_body_2: 100024198. Use of this data is subject to the following conditions by way of exception to the standard Open Government Licence referred to at the foot of this page:
ordnance_body_bulletpoint_1: You are granted a non-exclusive, royalty free revocable licence solely to view the licensed mapping and addressing data for non-commercial purposes for the period during which we make it available;
ordnance_body_bulletpoint_2: You are not permitted to copy, sub-license, distribute, sell or otherwise make available such data to third parties in any form; and
ordnance_body_bulletpoint_3: Third party rights to enforce the terms of this licence shall be reserved to OS.
ordnance_title: Ordnance Survey terms and conditions - GOV.UK
payment_failed_expired: The payment was not completed within 90 minutes of being created
payment_failed_not_taken: No money has been taken from your account.
payment_failed_rejected: The payment was rejected by the payment provider. Please ensure that you entered your card details correctly and that you have sufficient funds in your account.
privacy_dp_officer_body_1: Our Data Protection Officer (DPO) is responsible for independent advice and monitoring of the Environment Agency’s use of personal data. You can read our
privacy_dp_officer_body_2: which explains how we deal with personal data in general. If you have any concerns or queries about how we process personal data, or if you would like to make a complaint or request relating to data protection, please contact our DPO using the following details:
privacy_dp_officer_body_link: personal information charter (opens in new tab)
privacy_how_body_1: We are the Environment Agency and we are the official authority for issuing fishing licences in England (except the River Tweed), Wales and the Border Esk region of Scotland. We are the controller for personal data collected and processed for our Get a fishing licence service. A data controller determines how and why personal data (personal information) is processed.
privacy_how_body_2: Children under the age of 13 do not require a licence and you should not provide us with their personal data. If you are not the angler and you are providing us with someone else’s personal data to apply for a licence on their behalf, please make them aware of this privacy notice.
privacy_length_kept_body_1: We will keep personal data for the duration of the licence and for 6 years after it expires in line with our standard information retention policy.
privacy_needed_body_1: The personal data we need about the angler is:
privacy_needed_body_3: We require this personal data because it is necessary to process the application for a licence. If you don’t provide this information then we can’t issue a licence.
privacy_needed_body_4: The lawful basis we rely on to process your personal data is article 6(1)(e) of the UK GDPR, which allows us to process personal data when this is necessary to exercise our official authority set out in law (in this case the Salmon and Freshwater Fisheries Act 1975).
privacy_needed_body_5: If you have a disability and would like to be issued with a disabled licence, you can voluntarily provide us with your:
privacy_needed_body_6: If you would like to receive marketing emails from us you can sign up to receive our email newsletter.
privacy_needed_body_7: The lawful basis we rely on for processing this special category personal data is your explicit consent under article 6(1)(a) and 9(2)(a) of the UK GDPR. We will only use this personal data to assess your eligibility for a disabled licence. Consent can be withdrawn at any time.
privacy_needed_body_bulleypoint_3: contact details including phone number, email address or both
privacy_subheading_length_kept: How long we keep personal data
privacy_subheading_what_we_do: What we do with personal data
privacy_subheading_where_stored: Where personal data is processed and stored
privacy_title: Privacy policy: get a rod fishing licence
privacy_usage_body_1: We use Google Analytics to collect anonymised information about how the service is used. We use this data to improve the service and understand what users click on while using our service.
privacy_usage_body_2: We do not send any personal data (for example, names or addresses) to Google that could be used to personally identify you and Google are not allowed to use or share our analytics data.
privacy_usage_body_3: We will only collect this information if you give your consent when you first arrive at our website and again if you return more than 24 hours later.
privacy_usage_body_4_1: Your data is collected in line with Google's
privacy_usage_body_4_2: . If you do not want Google Analytics to collect your information when using our service, you can
privacy_what_we_do_body_2: We may use other organisations to do any of these activities on our behalf. These include:
privacy_what_we_do_body_3: We do not use personal data to make an automated decision or for automated profiling.
privacy_what_we_do_bulletpoint_1: process your transaction, including taking payment
privacy_what_we_do_bulletpoint_11: Paragon - for licence printing and mailing
privacy_what_we_do_bulletpoint_13: SmartSurvey - to ask anglers to provide feedback on the service
privacy_what_we_do_bulletpoint_14: GOV.Notify - to communicate information about licences
privacy_what_we_do_bulletpoint_hh: HH Global - for catch return reminder letter printing and mailing
privacy_what_we_do_bulletpoint_2: determine the type of licence (based on age and disability information if provided)
privacy_what_we_do_bulletpoint_3: issue a licence and send this to the angler
privacy_what_we_do_bulletpoint_cr: issue catch return forms and reminders to the angler
privacy_what_we_do_bulletpoint_6: email newsletters to people who sign up
privacy_what_we_do_bulletpoint_7: ask anglers to provide feedback on the service
privacy_what_we_do_bulletpoint_9: GOV.UK Pay and Worldpay - for card payments
privacy_where_stored_body_1: We transfer personal data through Amazon Web Services (AWS) servers in the UK. We store the data on Microsoft Azure servers in Ireland.
privacy_where_stored_body_2: The organisations we share personal data with process and store data in the UK. Our processor may also store this data outside the UK in Switzerland.
privacy_where_stored_body_3: We do not store payment details.
privacy_where_stored_body_4: Our payment service partners Worldpay and GOV.UK Pay are compliant with the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS).
recurring_payment_set_up: I agree to set up a recurring card payment
recurring_payment_set_up_back: Or go back and choose to pay for a single licence
recurring_payment_set_up_body: Setting up a recurring payment means you understand and agree that:
recurring_payment_set_up_bulletpoint_1_2: will be taken now for your 12-month
recurring_payment_set_up_bulletpoint_2: future payments will be taken annually to cover the cost of renewing your 12-month licence
recurring_payment_set_up_bulletpoint_3: you can cancel these payments at any time
recurring_payment_set_up_bulletpoint_4: the future cost of a 12-month licence may change
recurring_payment_set_up_bulletpoint_5_e: we will send you an email showing the cost before the next payment is taken
recurring_payment_set_up_bulletpoint_5_l: we will send you a letter showing the cost before the next payment is taken
recurring_payment_set_up_bulletpoint_5_t: we will send you a text message showing the cost before the next payment is taken
recurring_payment_set_up_bulletpoint_6: you need to tell us if your address or contact details change
recurring_payment_set_up_bulletpoint_7: card payments will be taken following these
recurring_payment_set_up_bulletpoint_7_l: terms and conditions (opens in new tab)
recurring_payment_set_up_error: Select if you agree to set up a recurring card payment
recurring_payment_set_up_title: Set up a recurring card payment
recurring_terms_conditions_cancel_bank_b: If you cancel a recurring card payment through your bank, we may not know about this until we try to take the payment.
recurring_terms_conditions_body: A recurring card payment is a regular debit or credit card payment taken with your agreement to pay securely for future fishing licences.
recurring_terms_conditions_cancel_body_1: You can cancel your recurring card payment to end the payment agreement at any time. Cancelling your recurring card payment will not cancel or refund your current licence – you can still fish until your current licence expires.
recurring_terms_conditions_cancel_body_2: If you have received a refund for your licence (
) your recurring card payment will be cancelled automatically.
recurring_terms_conditions_cancel_body_3: If you would like to change the number of rods or type of fish covered by your next licence, you will need to cancel your recurring card payment and buy a new licence.
recurring_terms_conditions_cancel_body_4: If you become eligible for a disabled concession, you can cancel your recurring card payment and buy your next licence at a reduced price.
recurring_terms_conditions_cancel_phone_: Phone 03708 506 506 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm) up to the day before payment is due to be taken.
up to 14 days before payment is due to be taken.
recurring_terms_conditions_call_charges_: Find out about call charges (opens in new tab)
recurring_terms_conditions_payment_body_: You can give consent to set up a recurring card payment when buying a 12-month fishing licence online.
Our payment service provider (Worldpay) will take payments (in pounds) until you tell us or your bank to stop them. Payments will appear as 'Get a Fishing Licence' on your bank statement.
Payments will be taken annually before your new licence is issued.
The cost of a future 12-month fishing licence may change. For example, the cost may be higher because of a service-wide price increase, or lower if you become eligible for a senior licence.
If a recurring card payment fails, we will contact you so you can arrange to buy another licence if you want to continue to fish.
recurring_terms_conditions_payment_remin: Before taking a recurring card payment, we will tell you the payment amount using the contact details you have provided.
If your address or contact details change you need to tell us so we can update our records and issue your licence. Update your details by emailing
up to 15 days before your next payment, or by phoning 03708 506 506 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm) up to the day before your next payment.
recurring_terms_conditions_security_body: We will store and use your data following our
recurring_terms_conditions_title: Recurring card payments: terms and conditions
refund_bulletpoint_1_1: The Environment Agency can only refund the cost of a licence to the purchaser. All refund applications should be directed to the Environment Agency.
refund_bulletpoint_1_4: Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm (except public holidays)
refund_bulletpoint_1_5: Find out more about call charges (opens in new tab)
refund_bulletpoint_2_1: The Environment Agency will not charge a fee when you purchase a licence through our
refund_bulletpoint_2_2: . We do not recommend purchasing your licence through third-party sites, which may charge a fee on top of the licence cost. If you purchased your licence through a third party, please contact them directly to request a refund of the licence cost and/or fee. The Environment Agency will not refund licence holders for licences purchased through third parties.
refund_bulletpoint_3: If you purchase a licence in error or buy the wrong type of licence, for yourself or someone else, the purchaser can request a refund within 14 days of the original purchase date.
refund_bulletpoint_4: Where an error has occurred that is attributable to the Environment Agency, please contact us directly within 14 days of the original purchase date to request a full refund.
refund_bulletpoint_5: No refunds are offered on 1-day or 8-day licences. If you upgrade to a 12-month licence within 14 days of the expiry date of the short-term licence, we will refund the cost of the short-term licence after you have purchased the 12-month licence.
refund_bulletpoint_6: You can request a refund if you upgrade a 2-rod licence to a 3-rod licence within 14 days of the original purchase date. We will refund the cost of the 2-rod licence after you have purchased the 3-rod licence.
refund_bulletpoint_7: You can request a refund if you upgrade a coarse fish licence to a salmon and sea trout licence within 14 days of the original purchase date. We will refund the cost of the coarse fish licence after you have purchased the salmon and sea trout licence.

role_required_body_1: You were successfully signed in but you do not have the correct role assigned to access the telesales application.
role_required_body_2: Please contact your Microsoft Dynamics administrator to request access.
server_error_bulletpoint_1: If you have requested an email or text notification, this should be delivered in 3 hours if a payment has been taken.
server_error_bulletpoint_2: If you have bought a 365 day licence this should still arrive by post if a payment has been taken.
server_error_bulletpoint_3: If you would prefer a refund please ring the helpline using the number given below.
server_error_if_seeing_page: If you keep seeing this page:
server_error_logged: We have logged the error and we will look into it, and make sure it doesn’t happen again. However if you keep seeing this page, please send your
server_error_occured: Sorry, an error occurred while processing your request
server_error_environment_agency: If you keep seeing this page, you can buy a fishing licence by calling the Environment Agency:
server_error_environment_agency_link: Find out about call charges (opens in new tab)
server_error_environment_agency_opening: Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm (except public holidays)
server_error_try_again: This could be due to high demand for the service. Please wait a few minutes before entering your payment details again.
server_error_unable_to_process_payment: Sorry, we were unable to process your payment
server_error_unable_to_retrieve_pay_deta: We were unable to retrieve your payment details at this time because of an unexpected problem with the service. Please wait a few minutes and try again by pressing the 'Try again' button below.
server_error_unable_to_retrieve: Sorry, we were unable to retrieve your payment details
terms_conds_error_must_agree: You must agree to the licence conditions to continue
terms_conds_error: You have not agreed to the licence conditions
terms_conds_pay_on_gov_uk: on the GOV.UK secure payment site
terms_conds_warning: Do not close the browser or use the back button during payment
terms_conds_agree_notify_self: I agree to the licence conditions
terms_conds_body_notify_self: When you buy this licence you must:
terms_conds_bulletpoint_1_notify_self: not share your licence - it is only valid for the named licence holder
terms_conds_bulletpoint_2_notify_self: carry proof of your licence when you go fishing and show it to our enforcement officers if asked
terms_conds_bulletpoint_3_notify_self: get permission to fish from the owner of the water's fishing rights, usually a fishery or angling club, in addition to having this licence
terms_conds_bulletpoint_4_2_notify_self: that apply to the area you want to fish
terms_conds_bulletpoint_4_link_notify_se: national and local byelaws (opens in new tab)
terms_conds_bulletpoint_5_notify_self: only use your licence for the specified date and time, number of rods and species of fish
terms_conds_bulletpoint_6_notify_self: submit an annual catch return, even if you did not catch any salmon or sea trout, or did not go fishing - you can
terms_conds_bulletpoint_6_link_notify_se: submit a catch return (opens in new tab)
terms_conds_title_notify_self: Do you agree to the licence conditions?
terms_conds_agree_notify_bobo: I confirm the licence holder agrees to the licence conditions
terms_conds_bulletpoint_1_notify_bobo: not share their licence - it is only valid for the named licence holder
terms_conds_bulletpoint_2_notify_bobo: carry proof of their licence when they go fishing and show it to our enforcement officers if asked
terms_conds_bulletpoint_3_notify_bobo: get permission to fish from the owner of the water's fishing rights, usually a fishery or angling club, in addition to having this licence
terms_conds_bulletpoint_4_2_notify_bobo: that apply to the area they want to fish
terms_conds_bulletpoint_4_link_notify_bo: national and local byelaws (opens in new tab)
terms_conds_bulletpoint_5_notify_bobo: only use their licence for the specified date and time, number of rods and species of fish
terms_conds_bulletpoint_6_notify_bobo: submit an annual catch return, even if they did not catch any salmon or sea trout, or did not go fishing - they can
terms_conds_bulletpoint_6_link_notify_bo: submit a catch return (opens in new tab)
